68. Paulding received his first government appointment with the navy after Madison read his sketches of American naval victories and heroes in the Analectic Magazine. Paulding was given a cabinet post in 1838 as secretary of the navy by President Van Buren as a reward for services rendered to the party through journalistic contributions to the New York Evening Post
